abstract: Hundreds of black and Hispanic members of Local 28 of Sheet Metal Workers have received checks as part of settlement of discrimination suit filed against union, which was found to have routinely denied building construction work opportunities to minority members; case has opened up window into insular world in which union bosses and contractors determine who gets to work and when, and offers view of costs associated with discrimination and impact it has on minority workers.
lead_paragraph: Last month, a union began paying the first installments of $12.7 million in back pay to hundreds of black and Hispanic members in a partial settlement of a bias lawsuit decades old.

headline.main: New York Sheet Metal Workers Case Highlights Persistence of Workplace Discrimination
headline.print_headline: Metal Workers Get Back Pay in a Bias Case
